`Broad-LineRegion.jl` is a bit lengthy so I went with `BLR.jl` although I see that is not advised in the style guide. I quite like `BLR.jl` for this package and am hoping somenoe can manually override or suggest an alternative.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
As already hinted at on Slack, there is probably very little (if any) chance to have a three-letter acronym like `BLR` accepted. Since the General registry is a shared resource the entire Julia community, even if an acronym might be commonly understood in a narrow domain of potential users of the package, it should not be used as a package name. In this case, `BLR` could mean "Broad-Line Region", [or it could (more likely) mean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLR) "Base Lending Rate".

My recommendation would be to write out and probably pluralize the acronym, as `BroadLineRegions`. Unlike in other communities, long and descriptive package names are strongly encouraged in the Julia ecosystem, see the [Package naming rules](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-rules). This can take some getting used to for people coming from other languages, but once you do, you will find that it makes the ecosystem much more approachable. Fully writing out the acronym would allow you to still use the `BLR` abbreviation in your documentation and "marketing", up to and including recommending

```
import BroadLineRegions as BLR
```

as a way to use your package.
